com.hazelcast.spi

Interface NodeEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NodeEngineImpl

    public interface NodeEngine
    The NodeEngine is the 'umbrella' of services/service-method that gets injected into a ManagedService.

    So if you are writing a custom SPI service, such as a stack-service, this service should probably implement the ManagedService so you can get access to the services within the system.

      • getMasterAddress

        Address getMasterAddress()
        Gets the address of the master member.

        This value can be null if no master is elected yet.

        The value can change over time.

        Returns:
        the address of the master member

      • getThisAddress

        Address getThisAddress()
        Get the address of this member.

        The returned value will never change and will never be null.

        Returns:
        the address of this member

      • getLocalMember

        Member getLocalMember()
        Returns the local member.

        The returned value will never be null but it may change when local lite member is promoted to a data member or when this member merges to a new cluster after split-brain detected. Returned value should not be cached but instead this method should be called each time when local member is needed.

        Returns:
        the local member

      • getConfig

        Config getConfig()
        Returns the Config that was used to create the HazelcastInstance.

        The returned value will never change and will never be null.

        Returns:
        the config

      • getConfigClassLoader

        ClassLoader getConfigClassLoader()
        Returns the Config ClassLoader. This class loader will be used for instantiation of all classes defined by the configuration (e.g. listeners, policies, stores, partitioning strategies, quorum functions, ...).

        TODO: add more documentation what the purpose is of the config classloader

        Returns:
        the config ClassLoader.

      • getProperties

        HazelcastProperties getProperties()
        Returns the HazelcastProperties.

        The returned value will never change and will never be null.

        Returns:
        the HazelcastProperties

      • getLogger

        ILogger getLogger(String name)
        Gets the logger for a given name.

        It is best to get an ILogger through this method instead of calling Logger.getLogger(String).

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the logger
        Returns:
        the ILogger
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null
        See Also:
        getLogger(String)

        Returns:
        the ILogger
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz is null
        See Also:
        getLogger(Class)

      • toData

        Data toData(Object object)
        Serializes an object to a Data.

        This method can safely be called with a Data instance. In that case, that instance is returned.

        If this method is called with null, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        object - the object to serialize
        Returns:
        the serialized object
        Throws:
        HazelcastSerializationException - when serialization fails

      • toObject

        <T> T toObject(Object object)
        Deserializes an object.

        This method can safely be called on an object that is already deserialized. In that case, that instance is returned.

        If this method is called with null, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        object - the object to deserialize
        Returns:
        the deserialized object
        Throws:
        HazelcastSerializationException - when deserialization fails

      • toObject

        <T> T toObject(Object object,
               Class klazz)
        Deserializes an object.

        This method can safely be called on an object that is already deserialized. In that case, that instance is returned.

        If this method is called with null, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        object - the object to deserialize
        klazz - The class to instantiate when deserializing the object
        Returns:
        the deserialized object
        Throws:
        HazelcastSerializationException - when deserialization fails

      • isActive

        @Deprecated
boolean isActive()
        Deprecated. 
        Checks if the HazelcastInstance that this NodeEngine belongs to is still active.

        A HazelcastInstance is not active when it is shutting down or already shut down. Also see isRunning().

        Returns:
        true if active, false otherwise

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Indicates that node is not shutting down or it has not already shut down
        Returns:
        true if node is not shutting down or it has not already shut down, false otherwise

      • getService

        <T> T getService(String serviceName)
        Gets the service with the given name.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service
        Parameters:
        serviceName - the name of the service
        Returns:
        the found service, or HazelcastException in case of failure (null will never be returned)

      • getSharedService

        <T extends SharedService> T getSharedService(String serviceName)
        Deprecated. since 3.7, please use getService(String) instead
        Gets the SharedService for the given serviceName.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service
        Parameters:
        serviceName - the name of the shared service to get
        Returns:
        the found service, or null if the service was not found
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the serviceName is null

      • getVersion

        MemberVersion getVersion()
        Returns the codebase version of the node. For example, when running on hazelcast-3.8.jar, this would resolve to Version.of(3,8,0). A node's codebase version may be different than cluster version.
        Returns:
        codebase version of the node
        Since:
        3.8
        See Also:
        Cluster.getClusterVersion()

        the SplitBrainMergePolicyProvider
        Since:

      • getServices

        <S> Collection<S> getServices(Class<S> serviceClass)
        Returns a list of services matching provides service class/interface.

        Note: CoreServices will be placed at the beginning of the list.
